In summary, the Equal Protection Clause does not prohibit the Law School’s
narrowly tailored use of race in admissions decisions to further a compelling
interest in obtaining the educational benefits that flow from a diverse student
body.  Consequently,  petitioner’s  statutory  claims  based  on  Title  VI  and  42
U.S.C. § 1981 also fail.
Chief Justice Rehnquist, with whom 
Justices Scalia, Kennedy, and Thomas join, dissenting:
I do not believe . . . that the
